## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron ore mining and smelting setup at (15.5, 70.5)
- Electric mining drill at (15.5, 70.5) facing DOWN (output at 15.5, 72.5)
- Small electric pole at (13.5, 69.5) powering the drill
- Stone furnace at (16.0, 73.0) facing UP (new position)
- Wooden chest at (16.5, 74.5)
- Transport belts connecting drill to furnace (positions: (15.5,72.5) to (24.5,70.5))

### Power generation setup at (-9.5, -0.5)
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 0.5) connected via pipes to:
- Boiler at (-5.0, 3.5) (now has coal fuel)
- Steam engine at (-0.5, 3.5) (still not connected to power network)
- Pipe network connecting offshore pump to boiler (positions: (-8.5,-0.5), (-6.5,-0.5), (-7.5,-0.5), (-4.5,-0.5), (-5.5,-0.5), (-3.5,-0.5))
- Power pole at (3.5, 3.5) (existing)

## ERROR TIPS

### Placement collision errors (continued)
- Verify target position is clear before placing entities (now with 12 total occurrences)
- Added specific water avoidance checks when placing near shorelines (3 water-related placement failures)
- When replacing existing setups, clear old entities first before placing new ones

### Power system improvements
- Steam engine still not connected despite boiler being fueled - verify power pole connections
- Check power network coverage when placing new electrical devices

### Furnace placement strategy
- Survey terrain carefully before attempting furnace placement (4 failed attempts)
- Maintain minimum distance from water bodies when placing production structures
- Consider pre-clearing areas before attempting large placements

### Entity verification
- Verify entity existence before attempting operations on them (failed stone furnace check)
- Implement position validation before placement attempts

### Production chain planning
- Ensure complete clearance of old transport belts before redesigning layouts
- Verify all components are properly spaced before finalizing production chains

### Power connection verification
- Double-check power pole placements to avoid duplicate placement attempts
- Verify electrical connections after placing new power poles
